meanings.definition: A five-line poem with a specific syllable pattern.
meanings.sent1: In class, we learned how to write cinquains with five lines.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys reading cinquains because they are short and sweet.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled at the silly cinquains they created together.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of cinquains, each blooming with different emotions.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of cinquains lies in their concise yet expressive nature.

meanings.sent1: The gift basket contained cinquains of various chocolates.
meanings.sent2: He organized his stamps into cinquains based on their colors.
meanings.sent3: The cinquains of colorful pencils brightened up her desk.
meanings.sent4: The garden displayed cinquains of flowers in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The box held cinquains of seashells collected from different beaches.
